tweets.html:
Less than one more day until nobody has to talk about why they hate/love/don't care about the Oscars ever again!

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) February 26, 2012

Daytona 500, NBA All-Star Game and Oscars today. If you watch at least ten minutes of all three, you get a Real American merit badge.

— ðŸŽ„Chris WilsonðŸŽ„ (@realchriswilson) February 26, 2012

The pre-pre-pre-pre-pre Oscar coverage is beginning. Be there to watch delivery trucks unload water bottles.

— Ken Levine (@KenLevine) February 26, 2012

Recent events haven't changed my consistent Oscars prediction: Pain.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) February 26, 2012

Everyone keeps asking about a sequel to Bridesmaids. Someone needs to ask about "Remarkable Louder and Inconceivably Closer" #Oscars

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) February 26, 2012

If anyone's interested, tonight I will be not live-tweeting the Oscars while I don't watch them in character as myself.

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) February 26, 2012

"If you hate the Oscars so much, why are you watching them?"- Every 25th Motherfucker On Twitter In Five And A Half Hours

— Josh A. Cagan (@joshacagan) February 26, 2012

What if Michael Bay directed a silent film?

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) February 26, 2012

There will be more black celebs attending tonight's NBA All-Star game than have attended every Oscars award show ever.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) February 26, 2012

— Ken Jennings (@KenJennings) February 26, 2012

If you get obsessed with intense TV shows like "breaking bad" or "the wire" then you are going to fucking LOVE "too cute" on animal planet.

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) February 26, 2012

I hope Alexander Payne wins an Oscar tonight. Might breathe new life into my "About Schmidt" Omaha bus tour.

— Tim Siedell (@badbanana) February 26, 2012

I feel a deep connection to RyRy every time he mutters "bye bye" half to himself after the interviewee is already five feet away.

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) February 26, 2012

There's an idea: E!'s Oscar coverage with no audio. May be just about perfect.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) February 26, 2012

tweets.html:

Pretty sure that giant ring Kelly Osbourne is wearing is a horcrux. #Oscars

Kelly Osbourne is the first person I've seen on TV whose British accent doesn't make them seen smarter. #tweetroast

"I'm covered in white stuff!" - Ryan Seacrest, now and always.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) February 27, 2012

Why is everyone so crazy about this Chastain dress? She looks like she's from the cover of Michael Jackson's "Dangerous."

I love the fact that George Clooney is walking around with a life size Oscar. I mean, hello objectification. #oscars

I assume we're stuck w/the E! crew doing fashion handicapping because Seacrest demanded a shower. #oscars

I see no reason Kelly Osbourne's credentials as a fashion expert are any better than mine.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) February 27, 2012

i need Melissa McCarthy or Octavia Spencer to say "I'm wearing Lane Bryant...now back the eff up!"

Oscars would be better if it were like NBA AllStar wknd. Fri: breakout actors improv. Sat: monologue competition and Sun: nominees act off!

This years's dress theme: punishing your boobs. #oscars
